executive_summary: Performance for investigation services has been on a slight downturn for most of the period through 2024. Even so, while the pandemic slightly reduced income, the aftermath provided a considerable bounce back which cushioned the slumps for the rest of the period. As the pandemic waned, many businesses reopened and were looking for new employees, bolstering the need for background checks, which remains the most popular service offered by investigators. Nonetheless, rising competition externally and internally has led some operators to record low profits, forcing them to exit the industry. Overall, revenue for investigation services is set to climb at a CAGR of 1.3% to $8.3 billion through 2024, including a 0.9% dip in 2024 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: While investigative services prove reliable and valuable in various scenarios beyond background checks, much of private detective work can be handled by local or federal law agencies.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: TECHNOLOGY MAKES LIFE EASIER FOR INVESTIGATORS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Artificial intelligence and machine learning help expedite the background check process while providing more accurate information. Automated systems can be useful for criminal background, credit history, education and employment.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: UNPROFITABLE SERVICES WILL SLOWLY MAKE THEIR WAY OUT
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The rising prices of specific tools and technologies may put some investigators out of the industry. While investigation services may raise service costs to mitigate this, many consumers or businesses may stray away and look for more cost-effective alternatives, like using tools or relying on a local or federal government agency.

industry_definition: Operators in this industry are primarily engaged in providing investigative services, including fingerprinting and private detective services. This industry does not include establishments engaged in providing credit checks.
key_trends: The rapid advancement of technology has given investigation services the tools to help improve success rates. Automation systems have reduced the time needed for background checks while improving data aggregation.

Weakening corporate profit toward the end of the period has forced corporations to cut back on additional expenses. This downturn has been particularly challenging as business firms constitute the primary market for investigation services.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Almost three-quarters of revenue is generated from business firms, most typically giant corporations. Businesses hire investigators to conduct background checks before hiring new employees.

The federal government and its agencies rely on the help of private investigation services to assist with cases and other matters. Private investigation firms can bring in experts in areas like cybercrime and fraud.

Individuals typically rely on investigators for various private detective work, including infidelity, child custody, theft and missing person cases. They also request background checks for personal matters.
